    • Estimating caribou calving dates and locations using the TuktuTools Package

    Scan Multiple Movement Tracks at a Glance

    scan_tracks.Rd

    Takes list of individual (simple feature) tracks, and plots their tracks. Useful, e.g., for comparing proximity of animals. Includes a feature which computes and plots the distance between daily mean locations.

    scan_tracks(
  x,
  id.col = "ID",
  time.col = "Time",
  colors = NULL,
  distance.df = NULL,
  plotdistance = FALSE,
  d.col = "darkgrey",
  legend = FALSE,
  threshold = 1000,
  legend.pos = "bottomleft",
  ...
)

    Arguments

    x

    data frame, simple feature, or list of simple feature tracks

    id.col

    name ID column

    time.col

    name of POSIX time column

    colors

    vector of colors

    distance.df

    distance data frame (output of getPairwiseDistances) [COULD BE TRUNCATED]

    plotdistance

    whether to plot pairwise distances (only works for list of length 2) [COULD BE TRUNCATED]

    d.col

    color for distances [COULD BE TRUNCATED]

    legend

    whether or not to add a legend

    legend.pos

    location of legend

    ...

    additional parameters to pass to legend function

    Value

    If plotdistance = TRUE, returns the pairwise distance data frame.

    Examples

    require(TuktuTools)
data(simulated_migrations)

# latitude longitude
scan_tracks(simulated_migrations, legend  = TRUE)


# Use the simple feature version, with names in the legend
simulated_migrations.sf %>% 
  scan_tracks(id.col = "Name", colors = rainbow(18),
              legend= TRUE, legend.pos = "topleft")
